result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason W Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Case 13CF1335

superMiscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of Extended Supervision.

Follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

No association with know drug users or dearlers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged or distributed. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is waived on this case. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: From DRC dated 9/8/17 re defendant's completion of ERP with attached proposed order.
Received today, from the Defendant, requesting credit for time served.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 02/27/15 hearing.

Defendant Jason W Johnson in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Attorney Flanagan recites some corrections to PSI.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Flanagan makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT      **Consecutive to 13CF1335**
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 
____No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge IS WAIVED (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)

Defendant Jason W Johnson in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.   Timothy F. Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Flanagan states that Defendant was not produced until last evening and therefore he has not had the time to go through PSI with Defendant.   Court reschedules.   Bail remains as fixed.  DEFENDANT TO REMAIN IN WAUKESHA COUNTY JAIL.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 11:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Jason W Johnson in court, in custody, with Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Attorney Flanagan requests a sentencing date.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Defendant to be returned forthwith.    Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from  Racine County jal.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Racine County Jail.
Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Jason W Johnson in court, in custody, with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan. District Attorney's Office Law Intern Christine Bohn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense waives the preliminary hearing at this time. Defense acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint and pretrial offer. Atty Flanagan waives reading. Information filed. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Atty Flanagan requests a plea/sentencing date for both cases. Court sets cash bail at $2,000.00. Return to Racine County Jail forthwith. OTP to be prepared for next hearing from Racine County Jail.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 22, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Initial appearance on November 20, 2014 at 02:00 pm.
Clerk of Courts Office to prepare Order to Produce from Racine County Jail.
